Reviews.Title: Great value but not legacy friendly
Reviews.Author: J. Lee
Reviews.Content: Overall:I've had this set for a few months now. Despite the little criticisms I have, I think this set is an excellent value and the picture is breathtaking with a 1080p source or even 1080i over-the-air.Picture:It's a great display and I have no complaint at all with the picture.  It has presets for adjusting the picture and that is a nice feature; I use 'cinema' most of the time.Chassis:The chassis is a very elegant piano black and looks nice when it is off.  This is actually kind of important when you get a TV this large!Sound:The speakers are not great, but they are adequate.  They are in the back so you (at least I) need to turn them up more than you would for front facing ones.Inputs / Outputs:This is where the 'not legacy friendly' gripe I have shows up, and costs Panasonic a star.  The only audio _output_ is a digital optical output.  If you have a stereo with a corresponding digital optical input, you're all set.  However, I'm willing to bet many if not most homes don't have such an input.  This means that you must use the so-so speakers when you use the antenna or an HDMI source that doesn't have an analog audio output (including perhaps some digital cable boxes).  It isn't too big a deal for me since movie watching is usually via a DVD player and I run its (analog) audio output through my stereo and it sounds great.  However, it would have been EASY for Panasonic to have a legacy analog audio output.  On the input side, there is no S-video input.  I get why they didn't put this in; S-video is on its way out.  However, I have a legacy video camera with S-video output and it would've been nice to use it.I've used the SD card input and it is slick.  They have a way to let you quickly start a slide show of all the pictures in the camera and even navigate around on the SD card directory.  It was nicely done and when you see pictures from an SLR camera brought out to a 42" display the 'WOW' factor is pretty high.I've also used the DB15 connector for the laptop and it worked fine.  Be aware, if you want to use your laptop to stream video to this set, you will need a long VGA cable AND a long audio cable.  I found a combo cable on Amazon (both the video and the male-male audio cable on one 15' cable) that worked great.Remote:The remote is okay, but the buttons are quite close together so it is actually easy to press the wrong button when you do certain tasks.  The one I hit most often is VIERA TOOLS when I meant to hit INPUT.  I don't have anything that supports the VIERA standard (other than the tv) so I never want the VIERA TOOLS, but I do want to change the input fairly often.  The two buttons are right on top of one another and the VIERA TOOLS button is like 3x the size of the INPUT button.One thing I liked about the remote was a special "sub menu" button that lets you quickly get to things like the signal strength meter.  I get my HDTV signals off an antenna so I use the meter a good bit and it is nice not to have it buried under sub-menus.  Another cute feature on the remote is the favorite button.  You can program several favorite channels and get to them via this short cut.There are R G B Y buttons on the remote but get this: THEY DON'T TWEAK THE PICTURE.  They are used for special functions.  Uh, how about using F1 F2 F3 F4 for labels and color code those?  Otherwise everyone in the world will think these buttons are for picture adjustment.I really liked the INFO button; it shows you whether you're looking at 720p or 1080i or whatever and if the show is a digital source the name of the show, etc.  The FORMAT button lets you force 4:3 and has a few different 16:9 flavors that are nice to have.

Reviews.Title: Recommend
Reviews.Author: R. Newel
Reviews.Content: I replaced a 6 year old plasma TV that went out. My TV screen faces multiple windows. With the plasma I had to cover the windows with towels during the day to avoid glare. With this TV any glare is barely noticeable and only when the screen is dark. I'm watching it right now (day time) with the windows uncovered.I live at 5000 feet which caused the plasma to generate a lot of heat. That thing was hot! I could feel the heat radiating from it when I walked by. It did help heat my house in the winter, but probably caused the TV to give up the ghost. This Panasonic generates very little heat and is hardly even warm to the touch.The only issue is one I discovered after installing this TV and apparently many LCD TV's have this issue. With the TV powered on my dish network remote would not operate the dish network receiver. After entering the proper code it did operate the TV fine but not the dish network receiver. I had to put the remote withing 2 inches of the dish IR port to get it to function. I had a couple of very frustrating days fighting this thinking it was the dish receiver flaking out. Then I did some research and discovered the interference issue with the LCD TV and various receivers. Different LCD TV's have different fixes. Some fixes I found are: turn CATS on or off on the TV, turn energy savings on or off or adjust back lighting. On this TV you adjust the back light on the TV. This TV adjust from 1 to 100. I found that adjusting it below 45 the dish remote inconsistently operated the dish receiver. At 42 or lower the dish remote refused to operate the dish receiver at all. I set the TV back light at 78 and the problem was solved. My research showed that this issue is not limited to any one manufacturer and indicates manufactures are aware of the issue. The possible resolutions to this issue should be included in the manual.I ordered an HDMI cable with this TV, but it was shipped separately and am still waiting on it and am only viewing 480i. Even with an analog signal the picture is much clearer than my old plasma. However, with the analog signal I notice some fuzziness with quick moves on the screen. Most notably when using the dish TV guide. As I move around the guide it turns fuzzy for a fraction of a second, but it immediately clears up and becomes sharp. I suspect this will be resolved once I receive the HDMI cable and boost the resolution to 1080 since it's a fairly well known fact that an HD TV picture is less than perfect with an analog signal.I use the dish remote to operate the TV, but I will note that the TV remote buttons are large and well labeled. The exception is the keys labeled R, G, B and Y. They apparently have nothing to do with the RGBY connection. One wonders why they are labeled this way. On page 11 of the manual it notes the colored buttons are used for various functions and refers to pages 14, 18 and 31 for examples. I could find no reference to these buttons on pages 14 or 18. Page 31 simply says that these buttons are available when their purpose is displayed on the screen. I guess I'll find out what they're for when I need them. I don't consider this a negative because it doesn't concern me. It's just a little confusing.So far I am really happy with the TV. This is a good looking TV. The bezel isn't huge and the speakers are in back which I like. I had it up and running without ever cracking the manual. I look forward to when the HDMI cable arrives. Though I haven't used all the features I certainly recommend this TV. Just be aware of the IR interference issue and how to resolve it and you will be happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Just Fine
Reviews.Author: Doctor gee
Reviews.Content: This TV is fine. My biggest complaint is that the only sound output is through an optical cable. No RCAs, no headphone jack, no way out! I routed all my sounds out from cable, blue ray, DVR, and Wii to a switch with 4 inputs and one RCA or headphone jack for output for $30. I can connect it now to my home theater system. The images on the TV are crisp with no blur on fast action. Standard settings seem a little dark but it can be customized for every video input. Good overall set except for the sound. I had for about 2 months.

Reviews.Title: GREAT LCD HDTV!! I LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: VIVINE "Y.Z."
Reviews.Content: I just got this TV for 2 weeks. Works great for gaming, Laptop/PC  and HDTV. Great picture quality and sound. Very easy to set up! Sometimes, i use an HDMI cable  to connect my laptop with the TV, it did a great job as a big size monitor!!!! I am very satisfied! Love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture!
Reviews.Author: Abhishek Srivastava
Reviews.Content: I did extensive research before buying this one, and after having it for 2 weeks, I'm glad I picked it!This TV had the best picture quality of all comparable TVs (42" LCD 1080p HDTVs).  I was comparing between Panasonic, LG, Samsung and Sony.  I made multiple trips to several stores to check out this TV, specially when put next to other brands.  Needless to say, all look good when watching HD content, but if you pay close attention, you can tell the difference.  Colors in Panasonic looked the best to me - richer, and more natural.The remote is fairly intuitive, and non-HD content looks good as well.As for other features, they're pretty standard across all the brands within this price range ($500-600).My general advice to folks buying HDTV for the first time:When buying an HDTV, buy for (1) screen size and (2) picture quality - those two things you can't "upgrade" during the life of the TV.  Other features, like watching internet content, browsing the web, etc, can be easily added through (fairly inexpensive) external devices (BlueRay player, media boxes).  No point paying more to have those embedded in the TV.  You cannot predict all the new features and technologies that will emerge over the life of your TV (hopefully at least 5 years), so you'll have to rely on add-on's anyway.  Focus on getting the right screen size and the best picture quality.  For judging picture quality, don't rely on online reviews, but go out and see for yourself in local stores.  Check out several stores (3-4) so you can eliminate any element of randomness (e.g., incorrect TV setting in a store) from your observations.Panasonic was the best screen size and picture quality for my budget, and so far I'm very happy with my choice!

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: Maxtro
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about a month and I love it. It does everything I want it to. Despite it "only" being 60hz I simply can't see anything wrong and I often use it to play games and watch sports, which are the areas where 120hz is supposed to be better.Being able to edit the name of inputs is great. I also love that I can use the TV remote to change the volume on my receiver. Having three HDMI ports is also a bonus.Overall a great TV. Should be happy with it for many years.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for typical user
Reviews.Author: Energy Guy
Reviews.Content: This is the second Panasonic TV I have purchased from Amazon, and it is perfect for my needs.  Took it out of the box, plugged it in, turned it on, and was watching it in a matter of minutes.  It has plenty of inputs for my other electronics and is very clear.  However, I am not using this TV in a media center, so I can't comment on it's performance in that application.  One bad thing was that the delivery company was very slow, so the shipment tracking system isn't very helpful as the shipper got the TV as indicated by the on-line system, but I got it many days later after negotiating a delivery time (not very convenient).  However, I have experienced this problem with any large item I have delivered by any on-line entity.

Reviews.Title: VERY HAPPY
Reviews.Author: T. sharpe
Reviews.Content: When our former television was snatched by the grim reaper, I was nervous about choosing a replacement.  The Panasonic was recommended to me, and what a television for the money!!  We are very pleased with the picture and audio quality.  I highly recommend this television.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: I. A. Roman
Reviews.Content: The television is amazing for the price.  It's not a top of the line LCD but the bang for the buck is phenomenal!The price is low for an IPS panel1080p (unlike other televisions in it's price range)Image quality is very goodThat about sums the TV up.  I'd recommend a buy to anyone looking for a lot of TV for a little bit of money.

Reviews.Title: Tv great Delivery ridiculous
Reviews.Author: Emmet "Emmet"
Reviews.Content: The Tv is fine and just what I expected.  so far i have not figured out how to hook up my remote speakers and it has something to do with the analog/digital world.I want to stress that the delivery of the product was very poor.  Statements wee made on the amazon website that the delivery people had tried to contact me and they did no such thing.  This happens all the time with the Post Office but that is another big problem.  When I called about the product I was run around and then it turned out the TV was in another state. There were repeated attempts calling Amazon and there was nothing but confusion with the same comment about them contacting me in the Amazon order list.  It finally got to me but it is good I am retired because i do not know how a working person could deal with this.

Reviews.Title: Just a really great TV
Reviews.Author: RRR
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about two weeks now. We were upgrading from a 19-inch (about 5 years old) flat screen. Yah, there's a MAJOR difference for you.The TV was easy to set up and operate. The picture is beautiful. The sound is fine for little TV speakers. Better sound will need better add-on components. And we will do that at some point.The factory settings for color seem way too hot. I've played with the settings and it helped a lot. Sports teams in orange uniforms still are way to bright.I like this TV a lot. Totally worth the great price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Quality! Great Bang for small buck :)
Reviews.Author: Christdoss Yesudhason "superstar27"
Reviews.Content: When I saw this item for sale on amazon I didn't believe the price; though the item was listed as used but like new, I didn't even hesitate to buy; what a great buy I did; the product is just store return and not a single scratch on front or back or anywhere in the unit and it was in full original box but opened item. Thats all.Hooked it up rightaway at my basement fitness room and picture quality is great and sound quality is phenomenal; I didn't expect I'll get this excellent product at this cheap price.Not a single dead pixel, NADA;  everything is great and I recommend this product to anyone who wants decent quality TV.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Janice RP
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this television.  I bought it for my basement where my husband has a work shop and a work out area.  We watch it during those activities.  Thinking of getting one for our family room.

Reviews.Title: A fantastic TV set
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I'm extremely impressed with this set. I've been using both high-definition cable and testing various game systems on it, and the picture quality is great regardless of whether 480i or 1080p. Images are extremely sharp, the sound quality is great for a pair of default, rear-mounted factory speakers on the set. There's a variety of connections available for audio, video, and gaming setups- as well as 3 hdmi connections if you'd rather not mess with a ton of wires all over the place. The only thing it seems to lack is an S-Video connection, which doesn't much matter as manufacturers have been phasing those out since the introduction of flat-screen displays.I happened to pick this up when there was a deep discount being offered by Amazon, so the $400 price was quite the bargain for a top of the line, high-quality name brand like Panasonic. And at ~50 lbs, it's a breeze to move from one area to another if you're unable to figure out if something like this should go in the bedroom or living room.(Now if only the wall mounting brackets arrived at the same time- although with a set this nice, I'm considering going all out and getting a decent stand for it now!)

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: E. Kovacs
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic TV is great. I already have a Panasonic TV, and its a excellent TV, top of the line.So, when I needed one for my other room, so, I wanted a Panasonic.And Amazon had this one for a great price.As with all Amazon deliveries, it arrived on schedule, as promised.(Now, if my cable service was half as good as my Panasonic, I'd be in businness)

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Alie
Reviews.Content: I love this TV!!!! I did alot of research because I did not have a lot of money to spend on a tv. I have never owned a flatscreen so I was not sure what to look for. I knew plasma was out, and that I could not afford LED. This product is perfect for the price and quality! It was is I want in a tv. The HD picture is fantastic but I would definetly say that a HDMI cord is a must for this. I highly suggest this product for anybody, the picture is so crisp and clear, and the sound is nice. (Even though I will be hooking it up to a sound system). Anyway, in the end I say it is a great product!

Reviews.Title: GREAT PANASONIC LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Russell Jay "Russell"
Reviews.Content: Great LCD. Far better than the cheaper plasma versions of the same TV.  How anyone could give this ONLY 4 stars... is amazing.Apparently he thought 623 dollars should buy both a 42 inch hugescreen TV with 1080 resolution AND have Bose Speakers with surround sound. Sorry, it doesn't come with Bose Speakers.4 star rating was inaccurate... speakers are fine and maybe the guy has a hearing aid who gave it the 4 star rating.Easily a 5 star item... crystal clear reception, easy to use and a great LCD HDTV.  I see almost no difference between this $623 Panasonic and other brands which cost much more money. This should be all you need, unless you are very very fussy... which may be in your cable line or dish... and have nothing to do with your TV anyways. You will like the reception.  If money doesn't make any difference, why not buy 20 models... and throw out the 19 TV sets that don't please you... (and hope the one you kept doesn't crap out the next day) Panasonic vs LG is like Mercedes to Yugo. (Yugo was the cheapest car ever made) Ask anyone who works at Walmart how many LG TV sets are returned in a month. You can see PANASONIC TRIED VERY HARD to put QUALITY in this product... IT IS OBVIOUS IN EVERY WAY.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Viera 42" class
Reviews.Author: Books, Books, Books "S.A.W."
Reviews.Content: This 42" Panasonic replaced a 32" TV but because the Panasonic is a flat screen it looks much less intrusive in our living room which makes me happy.  The picture is excellent, the design is sleek. Amazon's price was unbeatable.  I do wish the speakers weren't located in the back. I have a hearing problem and a few programs have much lower sound levels than others making it harder for me to hear.  Otherwise I would have given it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much when I purchased this TV.  It was a compulsive buy in the store on black Friday and I pretty much purchased it because of the size that I wanted (42 inches) and it had a nice piano black finish to it.  Oh, and the price was outstanding (similar to what it can be had for on Amazon right now).  However the picture quality is outstanding and really the best that I have seen.  IMO, it can easily go up against all those other top brands without any noticeable difference in the picture.  Also, I found out tonight after playing around with it and by reading the op. manual finally, that the picture auto dims and brights based on the ambient lighting in the room.  I found this out because the picture was a little too bright for the vivid that I had the picture setting on.  I then changed it to standard and turned off the lights.  When this happened, I noticed the picture went a little dimmer, but everything adjusted together and it looks well balanced.  Watching Grey's Anatomy, everything looks true to color, sharp and vivid now that it is in standard mode.  When I had vivid on, it was slightly too bright and straining on the eyes.  Just a little tip if you decide to buy this set, which I highly recommend!!Also, I forgot to mention that the sound on this is also very good.  It sounds rich and full.  I am surprised at how good it is being that the speakers are in the back of the set!

Reviews.Title: Quality through & through
Reviews.Author: Terry Ferrier
Reviews.Content: It has been 30 years since I last owned a Panasonic TV. After 20 years that TV still had a great image and never broke down. Since that time, I tried 4 other brands and had been disappointed every time. When I bought this TV and plugged it in I was instantly pleased. The picture was amazingly clear and the color intensity rich and vibrant. The viewing angle was equally awesome. This HDTV is in my basement and has no external antenna attached to it. I was overjoyed by the fact that it seems to use the cable plugged into it as an antenna because it gets channels that my TVs on the 1st and second floor, (with antennas attached to them), can't even pick up. The price on amazon was outstanding. What a GREAT buy.  All and all I am extremely pleased with this TV.Panasonic TC-L42U22 42-Inch 1080p LCD HDTV

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: liz
Reviews.Content: Great tv and so easy to set up.  The picture quality is so nice.  I did a lot of research and I am so glad that I decided on this one.  The price is great.  They delivered it right to my door.  Great TV

Reviews.Title: Great Tv
Reviews.Author: ohio123
Reviews.Content: Wonderful picture! Looks great on our wall. Not sure about speakers, we have surround hooked up to it so the sound is great. Great value.

Reviews.Title: Sound....What sound???
Reviews.Author: Wayne Rudolph "take-1"
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for 2 months now, and I absolutely love the picture. I replaced a 32" Toshiba (rotten picture/great sound) with this 42" Panasonic (GREAT picture/rotten sound). I can't believe that this big, beautiful set has NO VOLUME. Why couldn't they include a RCA jack for connection to a standard entertainment system to make up for their screw up? Why make things so difficult with an optical jack?? I was going to deduct 2 stars because of the terrible sound and no RCA jack, but the picture is so gorgeous, I only took off 1 star. If you have a hearing aid you should be just fine, but turn it up all the way.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded all expectations
Reviews.Author: Dave Halker
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV in October through Amazon and what amazed me the most was how fast it shipped. Fantastic service. Not sure the local retailers could do the same. When the big box arrived via UPS in less than one week, I unpacked it, hooked it up to Direct TV and was up and running in 20 minutes. Excellent picture ! Easy to setup ! Nice styling ! Nothing but high marks. Not sure this price can be beat either, especially, when you consider tax and shipping.

Reviews.Title: awsome bedroom tv
Reviews.Author: J. Gorglione "joeyg323"
Reviews.Content: bought this for my master bedroom, which is bigger then most, so i upgraded from a 27 inch panasonic tube tv. the clarity on this 42 ich 1080p. thought this was a great buy for the price. recommend this tv to anyone looking for a QUALITY TV. DID do a lot of reseach and this is midgrade panasonic ,panasonic is rated the best with consumer reports has the lowest percentage of breakage.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: donnyspi
Reviews.Content: Awesome TV.  No need to pay more for a higher end TV.  Needed some brightness adjustments at first, but then was good to go.  I don't use the speakers in the TV as I have it hooked up to a sound system.  Would definitely purchase again (but wait a couple weeks since the price ended up dropping!).  Would definitely recommend to a friend.Was kind of a pain to arrange for delivery with CEVA.  Amazon said delivery would be Dec 1-2.  CEVA ended up coming on Dec 10.  Was worth the wait for no tax and free shipping though.

Reviews.Title: Friendly TV Interface
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: I am quite happy with my new TV.  The picture comes in clear and the sound quality is good, but I expected that much when I ordered it.  I was pleasantly surprised when the menu didn't try to complicate the process of adjusting it to my specifications.  Being able to label inputs is a plus, and I've known TVs where each input needed to be scrolled through, and this one actually does jump to the one you want by pressing the corresponding number.  There are plenty of spots to plug your various devices into, and since I'm treating the TV as a large monitor for such external devices (videogame systems and laptop only), that made me glad.

Reviews.Title: went with majority
Reviews.Author: Curtiss Rogillio
Reviews.Content: After reviewing many reports and reviews I am pleased to say that I got exactly what was expected.All research revealed was accurate and there have been no surprises.I am extremely pleased with the product and the service from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great LCD HDTV.
Reviews.Author: G
Reviews.Content: This Panasonic LCD HDTV is great tv for your buck. If it had the speakersFacing front, it would've gotten the extra star. That isn't a big issue though. Easy to use remote and to set up :).

Reviews.Title: Panasonic = quality
Reviews.Author: nebraska
Reviews.Content: I have learned there are companies to buy high end electronics from and those to not even consider.  Panasonic is quality. the clarity is excellent set up is excellent, sound is excellent.  this thing is on all day long and is coming up on its second year of operation with no problems.

Reviews.Title: 2+ years and still perfect.
Reviews.Author: E. Arenz
Reviews.Content: I've had mine for a couple years and the picture is very bright, I would say excellent.  Also no problem with any of the ports, HDMI or otherwise.  Couldn't be happier, I use most of the inputs (all 3 of the HDMI, the SD, the USB and the component RGB) and they all work great.  Also, for some reason this TV is compatible when streaming HDMI from my Vizio tablet while my Vizio TV is not, go figure.  The speakers are fine for a TV, but as with ANY TV:  if you want really good sound add a soundbar or surround system.  Sound output is digital only so buy a soundbar with digital input, most if not all modern ones have this.  I have this in the master bedroom and the auto off after 3 hours is a great feature...

Reviews.Title: very happy
Reviews.Author: kim1241
Reviews.Content: we received this in a timely fashion.  We were very very happy and would order this again from this same company.

Reviews.Title: Not bright enough! All 3 HDMI Inputs Failed after a year
Reviews.Author: remermn
Reviews.Content: Have owned this TV for about a year and a half and it has several issues.  The TV does not get bright enough even at night with full brightness the picture just isn't that bright.  In addition, all 3 HDMI ports failed about a year after getting this TV (of course just out of warranty!).  Judging from various online forums this is a common problem with this set. The problem appears to be with the main board which would make sense because all parts suppliers of this circuit board are currently out of stock.  Another issue is the auto channel programming feature.  Realizing that I live in a rural area and am still in the stone age using an antenna however I have stations in different directions so I have a rotor on the antenna to point it to these stations.  This TV when you auto scan wont let you keep the previously scanned channels.  So with the antenna pointed West I scan and get all channels west of my location.  However, when I want to watch a channel East of me after pointing the antenna East I have to rescan the channels to get the East channels thus losing  all West channels.  Essentially a poor software design by an engineer who has no idea that some customers live in rural area and still use antennas!! One final issue with this set is the sound.  The speakers point to the rear of the TV therefore the volume has to be set higher and the sound is distorted.  Cannot recommend this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic 42" LCD HDTV  TC-L42U22
Reviews.Author: Brian T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased this television for our combined Christmas present to each other. We have never owned an LCD HDTV. We read all the reviews on this TV on AMAZON.COM and alot of other sites and decided the Panasonic TC-L42U22 was the best value for the money. It arrived on the day that AMAZON told us it would and it was very easy to install. We had it set up on Christmas day in time to watch the Christmas day parades. We were amazed at the clarity of the picture and sound. We made the right choice buying the Panasonic LCD TV. Our friends have different brand LCD televisions, we think our set is cleaner and crisper than theirs. One friend, after seeing the picture on our set ordered the same model for his family room. I would and have recommended the Panasonic LCD HDTV to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Hosedraggerz
Reviews.Author: D. Wilkow
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice tv.  I am not big on Panasonic, but I have to give them credit.  It has a GREAT remote, very nice picture, and the sound is clear.  I recommend this tv if you are looking for a 42" LCD.  I bought this tv for $550 with free shipping.  I would buy it again if I needed another 42" LCD tv.

Reviews.Title: HDTV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a great television.  I purchased one for myself and my son was so impressed with the picture he purchased one as well.

Reviews.Title: Solid.  legacy unfriendly is fair statement
Reviews.Author: Optimized_Shopping "Optimized_Shopping"
Reviews.Content: I actually bought a variant version of this same TV for sale in Asia (we moved to Singapore recently).  Picked this one up on a major retailer sale.  The asia model equivalent is U20 instead of U22, but I checked the specs and it appears to be the exact same thing.Overall, this TV has great picture quality for the money for sure.  DVDs look great on this - 1080 is beautiful for sure.The speakers are in the back and weak - I had to turn up the volume to the 70s to hear clearly speech.the lack of legacy connections are a problem indeed.  no S video, one optical out only.  Making matters worse, it seemed my (oldie) Pioneer receiver (VSX710S), from about 10 years ago, is unable to talk to this thing.  The optical out doesn't work... even when I turn off the Bitstream signals to PCM... still no dice.  Not sure if the TV optical is broken, but I also checked the optical out from a Viera blueray player and it was the same problem.  looks like I need to buy a new HDMI-based sound receiver to get the surround sound that is a must for me.overall, for the price, it is great value.  the exterior looks nice, picture quality is good, sound is ok but not bad, and inputs are a bit lacking but survivable.  If you can get this for less than 600 bucks, go for it.  I paid 700 plus for my Samsung 23 inch LCD just back in 2006!  its amazing how fast technology advances.

Reviews.Title: Replaced 2006 720p TV
Reviews.Author: Bonnie N
Reviews.Content: Recommend this TV...This TV replaced our 2006 720p Sony model when the lamp burnt out. Gave it to my son who bought a lamp and that TV is back in service... The picture on this Pansonic is bright, sharp and detailed. The price was awesome.We had this product for only one month and so far I have to give it 5 stars. Hook up to the surrond sound and HDTV cable  box was easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Great Value!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Technotron
Reviews.Content: Just got this TV yesterday and its a unbelieveable TV for the price. Easy set-up, great picture, great price. I wish it was 120 Hz instead of 60 Hz but I need to get two more 42" TV's. So its going to be a hard choice to pay more to get a 120 Hz.

Reviews.Title: I can' believe how wonderful this TV is!
Reviews.Author: EJ
Reviews.Content: I set this television up, by myself, within 10 minutes. Attaching the pedestal and hooking it up to my FIOS box.  This is such an excellent value.  I think that the sound is fine, the picture quality is great! I got this as an open box/scratch and dent, but did not see a scratch or dent on it! It is flawless. Even when direct daylight is present the picture is visible! Amazing!!I am so pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Seems ok starter TV
Reviews.Author: ramsir
Reviews.Content: Only reason I bought this TV is because this is the only model that did not have any reviews saying it died with blinking red light. Look at any model of any brand (Sony,Samsung, Panasonic, Vizio,...) all have this blinking red light death which is the reason I have been hesitating to buy it for the last 2-3 yrs. Just had this TV for little over a month now. Seems like OK TV just for watching DVDs and OTA broadcasts. I don't do any games. So, 60hz is not an issue. I am happy with it so far. Let's see when it will die. I keep my fingers crossed on these new unproven technology.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: prettybrowneyes
Reviews.Content: Going from a 27" tv that I purchased over 10 yrs ago to a 42" lcd 1080p tv is heavenly!!!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Paradiso
Reviews.Author: MikeD
Reviews.Content: I've had my Panasonic for 2 weeks and honestly I could not be happier. I think for this price range and screen size you're looking at the best deal on the market. The HD is sharp and clear. The blacks are black, and it has a great option to switch from Normal, Cinema, Vivid, or Custom view so that you can get the picture right where you want it. I prefer Cinema.I thought the volume was a tad low when I first set it up but after getting used to it I don't find it much of a problem. if you are a sound junky then you'll need to get some speakers that are Dolby friendly. The 3 HDMI outlets are especially welcomed and remote use is user friendly. What more can I say? It's a great television. If you're looking for something in the 40-47" screen size range but can't afford those $900 televisions this is the one you want. Honestly, I don't see how one priced more could be that much better unless you are a 3D fan. I am not.

Reviews.Title: viewing pleasure
Reviews.Author: R. Ericsson
Reviews.Content: This Panasonic HD TV is a dream. The picture quality is amazing. The look of the TV fits any decor. The arrays of features is huge. Satisfaction on a small stand or wall mount....and the price is right.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic 42" LCD 1080p HDTV
Reviews.Author: KPR
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price.  3rd Panasonic I've purchased over the past 5 years.  Good features and easy install

Reviews.Title: FABULOUS
Reviews.Author: Little$
Reviews.Content: Absolutely F A B U L O U S!!  I haven't had a new TV for quite a few years and certainly nothing as spectacular as this 42" Plasma.  The delivery was awesome, handled by two professional, helpful, pleasant men.  The TV is phenomenal.  Thank you Amazon for making it so easy and for your awesome price.

Reviews.Title: This is a great TV
Reviews.Author: Fender Precision
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV as a xmas gift for my mom and she first complained that it was much too big but now she loves it and is going through all her old videos and dvds and is watching them all over again on this TV because the picture is so clear and sharp.  It was great purchasing this TV from amazon.com because they gave me free shipping and it was delivered 3 days before Christmas and it was so convenient instead of running from store to store to compare prices and see if they had the TV in stock.  I'm very happy with the purchase!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic HDTV
Reviews.Author: Frieda Grischkowsky "sewing rocks"
Reviews.Content: Very fast delivery, got contacted in advance by the shipper to make out a delivery time. TV was very easy to set up. This is my first flatscreen TV, and I am very happy with the picture quality and the ease of operation. I don't have anything negative to say, and would recommend this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture!!
Reviews.Author: ErinG
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for the money.  The only thing I noticed is that the audio is a little bit low so you have to turn it wide open at times. The delivery went well; the guys were really nice & opened everything up to check and make sure that everything was intact and in working order before they left. The set up was totally easy.  Overall, a purchase I have been enjoying every day, especially with the playoffs on!!

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Angela Prenger
Reviews.Content: This tv is great. Picture is increadable and we really enjoy watching it. If you need a tv with this screen size i would definetelly select this one.will recomend to my friends !

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Good Brand, Satisfied customer!
Reviews.Author: Dilcia Figuera
Reviews.Content: Very glad I bought the TV since it's a fantastic deal on Amazon (i nearly bought the same thing on sears-com around thanksgiving for almost $[...] more with shipping). Overall great, clear picture. love seeing HD on it, for me, very drool-worthy.  no frills however, with 3 hdmi inputs (could use another one) and the only audio out is the digital optical (so not easy to hook up my bose system...) I have everything hooked up with hdmi cables and my wii with component, this is now my mainstay computer monitor!! awesome. would purchase again

Reviews.Title: Awesome picture quality!
Reviews.Author: Macuser
Reviews.Content: Stunning picture quality using my ordinary rooftop antenna.  Panasonic's color coded Quick Start guide and color coded cable connections, were very user friendly whereas Sony and some other TV makers can't be bothered with color coding.  Panasonic is also tops in reliability according to Consumer Reports.I was very worried about the fact the TV shipped from Adorama Camera instead of from Amazon because Adorama has draconian shipping and return policies as compared to Amazon.  However, I was delighted when I found the TV arrived at my doorstep double boxed to virtually eliminate the chance of shipping damage. So I now have very good confidence in ordering from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Nice Bargain!
Reviews.Author: Steve "Ugh, College"
Reviews.Content: When I received this TV, it was perfect...nice picture, good sounds (within 6 feet), the controls are very easy to program. I really enjoy this tv regardless what angle you sit at. Not a bad picture in the sunniest days or the darkest days. Excellent for vido gaming which I use it for and the hook up in the back are self explanatory.If buying from the Amazon store, dont expect the shipping to be precise. Excellent tv!

Reviews.Title: Bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: jibjabtoejam
Reviews.Content: Wall mounted w/ no problem good but not great display and fast motion is somewhat pixalated but for the price and limited vue time it works.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV
Reviews.Author: Mark Anderson
Reviews.Content: I love this TV.  I am using it as a second tv in a playroom.  They use it for the XBox, movies and TV.  I have only had it up and running for five days but it has performed perfectly.  The picture is amazing.  Thank you Amazon for another great purchase!!

Reviews.Title: Great value and happy overall
Reviews.Author: Anncamas
Reviews.Content: Overall happy with purchase of TV and Panasonic DMP-BD65K Blue Ray DVD player for $600 total at local Sears store last weekend (and esp happy that I could just pick it up with no black Friday crowds nor have the delivery hassle).  TV was well packaged and good finish quality.  However, don't care for the long thin remote design which results in an un-natural grip for my ladies (size large) hands (have not had this issue with my Sharp or Insignia TV remotes nor any other that I can remember).  Also, the stand is stationery, so would prefer swivel (new this when purchased).  Instruction book is adequate except the page on how to set up the stand - jumps from putting together stand to TV in the stand when actually there are 4 little screws that must be perfectly aligned in a little channel of sorts.  Combine this with the TV size (would be the same for all models/mfg), it's a two person set up for most of us : ) Sound is adequate with HDMI cable and excellent picture.  Finally, obscure factoid - two prong plug not grounded.  Not sure if grounding is done in the set these days or something to do with less current as energy star (so plug feels unsubstantial).

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Jose A. Mendoza Jr.
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for my room and its amazing.Picture is great as well as the price.No complaints me and mybkids love it thanks Amazon on a great deal :)

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Gonzalo D. Merayo
Reviews.Content: Image is a bit dark, but looks great. Sound is very good.Playing Guitar Hero on PS2 the lag is very noticeable, 68ms to my calibration.Announcement downside: does not make explicit that it's only 110v power and only NTSC analog input.

Reviews.Title: What we wanted and more.
Reviews.Author: Sher
Reviews.Content: Our new Panasonic TC-:42U22 42-inch 1080p LCD HDTV got here the night before we were to leave, Heading to Northern California. Had little time to set it up. Because the TV we were replacing was also a Panasonic. It turned out to be quite easy. The picture on our new Panasonic is Great! Easy to understand directions, on how it all works. I love all the extra's, like the SD Card in TV. Oh My. We do use that allot. Sound is wonderful! We haven't had a chance to try all the other hook ups yet, But I am sure it will all be easy. We have been told by many of our friends, That we got a really good deal, through Amazon.com. Oh course we did...Thank You,  Sher

Reviews.Title: Poor sound and poor user guide, good picture
Reviews.Author: E. Adamy
Reviews.Content: We ordered a Samsung 52" from Amazon a couple of years ago and have been extremely happy with it. Needed a 42" for second home and Samsung didn't make one so I settled on this Panasonic after studying the reviews of available 42" LCD flat screens. We've been watching it for about 3 weeks now.Wife and I agree that the sound coming from this TV is poor nor can we fix the problem using the extremely limited treble and bass controls provided. We are experiencing difficulty in distinctly hearing dialog across a range of movies on our DVD and Roku (NetFlix). I'm no audio expert so I can't say why the sound is poor but we are now considering external speakers.The user guide is terse. HDMI connections are simple but trying to figure out what cable is needed to connect a computer is a chore. Guidance and troubleshooting for sound problems is about non-existent.The picture is sharp and clear.The control manages both the TV and Panasonic Blueray DVD player. 3 easily switchable HDMI inputs makes it easy to switch among Dish 722 DVR, DVD, and Roku. We knew that the base does not swivel but the lack of a swivel base is still a minor annoyance, especially for this size TV.We plan to order a larger flat screen and it will be a Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Sound is a real problem!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Just Me
Reviews.Content: Don't buy it if you intent to listen thru the tv, the speakers are very very disappointing and you will be sorry if you buy this, there is better options with samsung and i actually got it, now i'm stuck with this :/

Reviews.Title: Not enough inputs
Reviews.Author: Ryan James
Reviews.Content: Okay, let's see: GameCube, xBox, PS3, DVD system, laptop... Um I needed to buy a media center just to have everything connected and switchable without touching the wires every single time. Would not buy again.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: K. Seidl "KSeidl"
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure I'm being fair by only giving it 3 stars but not sure which scale to judge it on.  As a TV, it's very OK and i'm giving it a 3.  For the money, it's great, and i would give it a 4 or 5.  I knew when buying a TV at this price it was not going to match my more expensive model, and it doesn't.  But I didn't want to spend more and this is exactly what I was expecting.  Picture is decent, not superb. I turned the sharpening down quite a bit and it got rid of the jaggies, but it's just missing some smoothness and detail that I can't quite describe.  The sound is really bad.  When I bought it I knew it only had tosslink out, but ignored it, and now I am annoyed it doesn't have component out and am going to need to buy a new stereo (the adapters are half the price of new receiver).Putting it together annoyed me more than is probably warranted.  My other TV is one piece- this one you need to put the base on. I have no idea why we struggled with it but we did.It doesn't hold a candle to my Samsung, but for what I paid and what I expected, it's perfect.
